channel.title: Easy problem
channel.description:
Ok, this is me, im new(bie)..
Hi, I got this problem: on sources like the ones where u got bat files with a compile, run and so. When I have compiled my settings (IP or something) I'm searching for a client to connect with? But there often is none and in every console (GUI or BAT) it says listening on port 43594 and then it doesnt happen anything. I have had this error for YEARS and I would be very grateful if someone could help me, just post SOMETHING, plz! :confused: :rolleyes:
[[u]INFO[/u]]
I portforwarded once but now I cant reach router and maybe settings deleted now?
I got Windows XP.
Also I editted paths in Enviroment Variables. my path is C:\[b]program[/b]\Java\<and the jdk version> not C:\[b]Program Files[/b]\Java\<and the jdk version>\
_________________ I will post anything u need and edit stuffs. This means alot to me :o :D ;D :P :rolleyes:

item.title: Easy problem
item.dc:creator: @Gilior Gilior
item.description:
@Gilior wrote:

Ifalldownalot:

I portforwarded once but now I cant reach router and maybe settings deleted now?

Your dynamic IP address had changed, therefore the port is not open. You need to get access to change the settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy problem
item.dc:creator: @Ifalldownalot Ifalldownalot
item.description:
@Ifalldownalot wrote:

Ok ty but…

I got a client in a folder and a RunServer in another folder (Same Private source but different downloads, 1 with a “client” 1 with a “source”)

Well, if I have to create a client in the RunServer folder, howto?
Also, when I run the RunServer.bat It is a console where it’s prompted: Listening on port 43594 after some secs. I have portforwarded now but it still don’t happen anything…

Is the RunServer.bat just a enigne who start server like NO-IP? So I can connect with a client that I enter my IP in?
If so, do I have to have the RunServer and the Run (client) in the same folder or something?

Read full topic

item.title: Easy problem
item.dc:creator: @opperrangepk opperrangepk
item.description:
@opperrangepk wrote:

do you have a client to connect whit?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 18, 2009, 05:16:35 am[/size][hr]I think you dont have a client cuz it whont do anything if you yust press run… it will only start but you whont be able to play download a client like 317 508 513 525 ore anything else wich is same type of your server add your ip to the client and run the client and the run.server bat and it will work and you will be able to play

Read full topic

item.title: Easy problem
item.dc:creator: @Ifalldownalot Ifalldownalot
item.description:
@Ifalldownalot wrote:

Ok, this is me, im new(bie)…

Hi, I got this problem: on sources like the ones where u got bat files with a compile, run and so. When I have compiled my settings (IP or something) I’m searching for a client to connect with? But there often is none and in every console (GUI or BAT) it says listening on port 43594
and then it doesnt happen anything. I have had this error for YEARS and I would be very grateful if someone could help me, just post SOMETHING, plz! :rolleyes:

[INFO]

I portforwarded once but now I cant reach router and maybe settings deleted now?

I got Windows XP.

Also I editted paths in Enviroment Variables. my path is C:[b]program[/b]\Java<and the jdk version>
not C:[b]Program Files[/b]\Java<and the jdk version>\

I will post anything u need and edit stuffs. This means alot to me :o ;D :rolleyes:
